item.title: We are still in play, says Philippine envoy on Pfizer vaccine acquisition
item.description: Philippine Ambassador to the United States Jose Manuel "Babe" Romualdez doesn't want to dwell on how the Philippines missed its chance to access around 10 million doses of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccines developed by Pfizer-BioNTech in the United States that were supposed to be delivered to the Philippines next month.

item.title: Lacson: Duque failure cost Philippines Pfizer vaccines by January
item.description: The failure of Health Secretary Francisco Duque III cost the Philippines a delivery of 10 million coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccines from Pfizer by January 2021, according to Sen. Panfilo Lacson.

item.title: Medialdea tells critics: Just wait for vaccine, good results will follow
item.description: Filipinos who criticize the government s procurement of vaccines against the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) simply need to be patient and they will see good results, Executive Secretary Salvador Medialdea said Wednesday.

item.title: Nagpakilalang taga-DOJ, huli sa pangongotong umano ng P1-M sa broker para 'di higpitan ng BOC
item.description: Nadakip ng mga operatiba ng National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) ang isang lalaking nagpakilalang empleyado ng Department of Justice (DOJ) matapos umanong kotongan ng P1 milyon ang isang broker bilang "pasalubong" sa bagong hepe ng Bureau of Custom.

item.title: NLEX toll holiday ends in Valenzuela after conditional lifting of permit suspension
item.description: The toll holiday on the North Luzon Expressway (NLEX) in Valenzuela City ended on Wednesday after the local government conditionally lifted its suspension of the toll operator s business permit.

item.title: Duterte on ICC findings: Kung makulong, eh di makulong
item.description: "Ba't mo ako takutin na mag-preso? If it's my destiny magpreso ako then magpreso ako," Duterte said in a televised briefing. "Kung may ginawa kami, sige. Kung makulong, eh 'di makulong."

item.title: Pompeo to quarantine after contact with COVID-positive person - US State Department
item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has come into contact with someone who tested positive for the coronavirus and will be quarantining although he has tested negative, the US State Department said on Wednesday.

item.title: Tugade apologizes to motorists, LGUs for RFID mess
item.description: Transportation Secretary Arthur Tugade on Wednesday apologized to the motorists and local government units who were affected by the massive traffic congestion and other inconveniences caused by the RFID system in some tollways.

item.title: Hospitals, medical personnel brace for COVID-19 spike during holiday season
item.description: “Kung anuman ang kailangan ng pasyente natin, COVID man o non-COVID ay handa kami, may sapat na supplies ang mga hospital, pati na rin kung kakailanganin ng ventilators. Mas marami na tayong kaalaman ngayon dahil sa ngayon marami na talagang information ang lumabas,” Dr. Encarnita Limpin of the Philippine College of Physicians.

item.title: Sec. Briones: May pag-aaral na mas mataas ang tsansang na magka-COVID-19 ang bata sa bahay kaysa eskwelahan
item.description: Inihayag ni Department of Education (DepEd) Secretary Leonor Briones na mas mataas ang tsansang mahawa ng COVID-19 ang mga bata na nasa bahay kaysa sa paaralan, batay umano sa ulat ng United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF).

item.title: Robredo notes lag in government's COVID-19 vaccine program
item.description: Vice President Leni Robredo laments that the government is still in the process of choosing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccine when other countries have already started their vaccination programs.

item.title: Philippines in talks with China for its first COVID-19 vaccine shot in March 2021
item.description: The Philippines is in talks with China for the first vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) that is expected to be administered in the country in March 2021.

item.title: Duterte lashes out at TRB 'incompetence' over RFID mess
item.description: "I don't think what you know what a regulator is. That's the problem," Duterte said.

item.title: Philippine hospitals, LGUs told to prepare for surge in COVID-19 cases
item.description: In a briefing with President Rodrigo Duterte in Malacañang, Duque said data showed the need to augment COVID-19 beds and mechanical ventilators in healthcare and isolation facilities.

item.title: BRIDGE, inilunsad ng DFA at UN para sa mga OFW na naapektuhan ng COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: Naglunsad ng programa ang Department of Foreign Affairs at United Nations na layong tulungan ang libu-libong overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) na napilitang umuwi ng Pilipinas dahil sa global pandemic na COVID-19.
